events.description: The FTSE 100 reached a fresh record high above 10,380.
Rising tensions between the United States and Iran impacting energy markets.
A rebound in precious metals prices lifting mining stocks.

facts.fact_text: The FTSE 100 rose more than 0.5% on Wednesday to a level above 10,380.

evidences.evidence_text: The FTSE 100 rose more than 0.5% on Wednesday, climbing to a fresh record above 10,380

facts.fact_text: Shell and BP shares increased by approximately 2% to 2.3%.

evidences.evidence_text: Shell and BP up around 2% to 2.3%

facts.fact_text: Relx fell 2%, London Stock Exchange Group fell 1.4%, and WPP fell 2.2%.

evidences.evidence_text: Relx down 2%, London Stock Exchange Group lower by 1.4% and WPP down 2.2%

claims.claim_text: The rise in the FTSE 100 was driven by energy and mining stocks.

evidences.evidence_text: driven by energy and mining stocks

claims.claim_text: Crude prices advanced due to rising geopolitical tensions between the US and Iran.

evidences.evidence_text: as crude prices advanced for a second session amid rising geopolitical tensions between the United States and Iran

claims.claim_text: Investors are reassessing risks to business models for companies vulnerable to AI disruption.

evidences.evidence_text: as investors reassessed risks to their business models

evidence.evidence_text: crude prices advanced for a second session amid rising geopolitical tensions between the United States and Iran
stocks seen as vulnerable to artificial intelligence disruption continued to fall... as investors reassessed risks to their business models
Mining shares also edged higher as gold and silver extended their rebound
